passages.text: Solid sales and earnings growth in 2Q25; momentum to continue in 2H25F; reiterate Buy

Midea announced its 2Q25 results (29 Aug) with another set of solid numbers. Quarterly revenue increased by \(11\%\) y- y to CNY124bn (1H25 revenue up \(16\%\) y- y to CNY252bn, the fastest among the three major Chinese white goods players we cover), while quarterly core earnings increased \(23\%\) y- y to CNY13.5bn (1H25 core earnings up a strong \(30\%\) y- y to CNY26.2bn, notably outpacing major peers). The faster growth of earnings than revenue in 1H25 was mainly driven by: 1) the 0.8pp y- y improvement in Midea's operating margin thanks to its cost- saving efforts (despite a 0.7pp y- y decline in the interim gross margin), and 2) contribution from financial income in 1H25. Midea also declared an interim dividend of CNY0.5 per share; together with Midea's share repurchase plan (CNY4.4bn quota already used), we see the company's continued commitment to shareholder returns. Midea, in our view, will maintain its solid market share gain trajectory as well as earnings growth momentum in 2H25F given the company's diversified business lines and proven operating capabilities. Maintain Buy with a higher TP of CNY98.00.

Midea noted that its 2C business will face more headwinds from the fading positive impact of the home appliances trade- in programs and potentially intensified price competition in 2H25F. With a resilient net margin level (1H25: \(10.3\%\) , higher than the company's targeted level of \(c.10\%\) ), Midea will focus more on protecting its market share in 2H25F with swift and proactive measures. Given Midea's solid operating track record, we forecast the company should be able to maintain a FY25F net margin of \(10.1\%\) amid its efforts to maintain its current sales momentum/market share, even if there is downward pressure on its gross margin in 2H25F.

We revise our FY25- 27F revenue and earnings forecasts \(3 - 4\%\) and \(6 - 7\%\) , respectively, to factor in Midea's strong 2Q25 results and our expectation of its protected net margin. We increase our target price to CNY98.00 (from CNY96.70), based on an unchanged 16.0x target F12M P/E applied to our end- Jun 26F earnings estimate (from end- FY25F). Our target price implies \(33\%\) upside potential. Midea currently trades at a FY25F P/E of 12.4x (EPS: CNY5.94)

Midea is a global technology group comprising five major business divisions the smart home business group, the industrial technology business group, the building technologies division, the robotics & automation division, and the digital innovation business.
Our target price of CNY98.00 is based on 16.0x F12M E which represents +1SD above the historical mean. The benchmark index for this stock is the CSI300 Index.
Downside risks include high commodity price, insufiying price competition and further worsening of the macroeconomic factors.

Midea is a POE home appliance company with its headquarter in Foshan, Guangdong province. Midea's current chairman is Mr. Fang Hongbo. The biggest shareholder of Midea is Mr. He Xiangjian with \(31.0\%\) shareholding (as of end- June 2022). There are nine members on the board of Midea, with three being independent directors. Midea has: 1) built a transparent, safe, cost- effective and sustainable industrial chain system, and 2) expanded the coverage of green home appliances.

A rating of 'Neutral', indicates that the analyst expects the stock to perform in line with the Benchmark over the next 12 months. A rating of 'Reduce', indicates that the analyst expects the stock to underperform the Benchmark over the next 12 months. A 'Bullish' stance, indicates that the analyst expects the sector to outperform the Benchmark during the next 12 months. A 'Neutral' stance, indicates that the analyst expects the sector to perform in line with the Benchmark during the next 12 months. A 'Bearish' stance, indicates that the analyst expects the sector to underperform the Benchmark during the next 12 months. Sectors that are labelled as 'Not rated' or shown as 'N/A' are not assigned ratings. Benchmarks are as follows: United States: S&P 500; Europe: Dow Jones STOXX 600; Global Emerging Markets (ex- Asia): MSCI Emerging Markets ex- Asia.
